invocation.name: Baptism (Blessing I)
invocation.description: Initiates a person into the religion. If the person was not previously a member of a religion, then they become capable of using luck, and receive one luck point. The person must be willing, and acceptable to the god.

invocation.name: Ceremony (Blessing I)
invocation.description:
The priest leads a group of people in prayer and ceremony in order to petition their god. Only those who are of the same (or a closely allied) faith can gain from this ritual, and each person can only benefit once a week. The cost must be paid by everyone present, in the form of a collection. Those who don't donate to the church, don't get any benefit. At the end of the ritual, all those present gain one point of luck, up to a maximum based on the number of people present, and the skill of the priest in petitioning the god.

invocation.name: Commune (Blessing I)
invocation.description:
The priest spends a whole day in prayer and meditation to his god, making the necessary sacrifices. At the end of the day, one point of luck is gained, up to a maximum based on the priest's invocation roll.

invocation.name: Liturgy (Blessing I)
invocation.description: Every person (of the same or an allied religion) who takes part gives a bonus of +1 experience to the next invocation skill the priest uses. The next invocation must be made immediately after this one.

invocation.name: Marriage (Blessing I)
invocation.description: Marries two people in the eyes of their god. Both must belong to the religion of the priest conducting the ritual.

invocation.name: Passage of the Soul (Blessing I)
invocation.description: Every person who takes part may give luck to the soul of a dead person. This helps them on their way to the afterlife.

invocation.name: Awe (Channel II)
invocation.description: Summons the presence of the god. All people within range who are not of the same religion must make a bravery check of Difficulty 20 + 1/5 invocation roll. Failure means they suffer a penalty to all actions of one fifth the invocation roll.

invocation.name: Endure (Channel II)
invocation.description: Target receives a bonus to stamina rolls equal to half the invocation roll for the duration that the invocation is continued. For each extra person (of the same faith) who takes part, the range is doubled.

invocation.name: Tongues (Divination II)
invocation.description: Allows the priest to understand any language at a skill equal to one tenth the invocation roll. Lasts for the duration of the conversation.

invocation.name: Truth sense (Divination II)
invocation.description:
Allows the priest to perceive a lie when talking to someone. The target person must have been baptised in the religion of the priest.
Target Knowledge
20
It is known if the target speaks mostly lies.
25
It is known if the target speaks a lie of commission, but the exact lie is not known.
30
It is known what lies were said.
35
Priest also knows if a lie of omission was made, but not what it was.

Priest knows how something is a lie - the degree of the lie, and possibly a hint at the truth.
50
Priest knows why a lie was said, or why a fact was missed out.

invocation.name: Question (Divination II)
invocation.boost: The priest may ask one broad question. The answer may be detailed, but there is no guarentee that it will be what the priest wants. However, it will generally be what the god wants the priest to know.
The priest may talk with the deity about one subject. Only questions relating to the desires of the deity will be answered.
invocation.description: Priest tries to discover the will of the deity. This may only be used at most once a month. It does not give knowledge of mortal matters, unless it directly concerns the diety or their priests. The basic invocation gives an answer to a specific yes or no question.

invocation.name: Curse (Channel II)
invocation.description: The priest attempts to invoke the displeasure of the god on a single victim, who must be able to hear the priest make the curse, and must know that it was directed at them. A single attribute, chosen by the priest, is reduced by one point, down to a minimum of one. The curse lasts until the victim receives a blessing from a priest.

invocation.name: Summoning (Spirit III)
invocation.description:
The priest attempts to summon a servant of their deity. The servant will appear at the end of the invocation, and will be willing to listen to the priest, and may carry out the priest's wishes if they coincide with those of the servant. If the wishes of the priest are at odds with those of the servant, the servant may become hostile.
Normally, a lesser servant of the deity is summoned.
Alternatively, the servant may be asked three yes/no questions. The servant is not omniscient.

invocation.name: True Sight (Faith III)
invocation.description: The priest can recognise any holy artifact for what it is, and will know to which god it belongs.

invocation.name: Command (Spirit III)
invocation.description: The priest can control or banish all divine servants within range, at a Difficulty of half that needed to summon them in the first place. Hostile servants can only be banished, whilst a friendly servant may be given instructions, as per summon.

invocation.name: Consecration (Faith III)
invocation.description: An invocation to sanctify an object or place. One vial of holy water can be blessed per 10 rolled with invocation.

invocation.name: Excommunication (Faith III)
invocation.description: Excommunicates a person of lower rank in the same religion. The priest must have good reason to do this. If the god finds the reason satisfactory, then the person is automatically excommunicated. An excommunicated person can receive no benefit from religious invocations, looses all luck, and will be recognised as such automatically by a priest of the same religion.

invocation.name: Exorcism (Spirit III)
invocation.description: Seeks to banish a possessing spirit from a victim.

invocation.name: Transcendence (Spirit III)
invocation.description: The priest's soul temporarily departs their body, which is left in a state of metabolic suspension.
